label: Heating Control
description: Thermostat for controlling the opentherm protocol
info_overview:
The Heating Control is the central point of your climate environment. You can overwrite the temperature setpoint of your thermostat, and this product also reports information about your thermostat or boiler. For example the room temperature, boiler pressure, modulation level or water temperature.

This product can be simply placed between your thermostat and boiler. The current setup is not changed and therefore you can still use the device as you normally would do. You don’t have to replace your current thermostat.

Note: This product only works if the current communication between your thermostat and boiler uses the standardized modulating protocol Open Therm. If you are not sure whether your thermostat/boiler uses Open Therm, you may find that in the manual of your thermostat/boiler. You can also find it on the internet. You can search for example on ‘Honeywell round clock open therm’.
info_inclusion: Press and hold the push button for 2 seconds and release to start the inclusion or exclude process.
info_exclusion: Press and hold the push button for 2 seconds and release to start the inclusion or exclude process.

parameters.label: Set to default
parameters.description: Set all configuration values to default values (factory settings)

parameters.label: Data request interval
parameters.description: Interval of updating data from thermostat and boiler
parameters.overview: The interval in seconds that data is requested (and therefore updated) from the thermostat and boiler.

parameters.label: T room update difference
parameters.description: Difference of temperature before new update
parameters.overview: The value that the room temperature must differ (compared to his previous send value) before an unsolicited room temperature report is send to the associated node.

parameters.label: T setpoint update difference
parameters.description: Difference in setpoint before new update
parameters.overview: The value that the temperature setpoint must differ (compared to his previous send value) before an unsolicited temperature setpoint report is send to the associated node.

parameters.label: Unsolicited CRC
parameters.overview: Configure if the unsolicited reports are send with the CRC-16 encapsulation. Not that the receiving node should support this encapsulation to parse the Z-Wave frame!

parameters.label: Type of 'special' thermostat
parameters.overview: Type of 'special' thermostat. NOTE: when remeha Celcia 20 support is set than any other thermostat cannot be set (!) NOTE2: when Remeha Celcia 20 gives 'Fout 203' send cfg value again

parameters.label: Enable/Disable thermostat schedule
parameters.description: Enable/Disable thermostat schedule inside the controller

parameters.label: Readout manual setpoint thermostat
parameters.overview:
This parameter is used to set the possible manual readout of the setpoint on the thermostat. If the thermostat is manually set to a different mode it is then possible to readout this value if enabled.

(NB. This setting is not in the manual but verified through contacting the service department of BeNext).

associations.label: Group 1
associations.overview: Every unsolicited report will be sent to the nodes in this group.

channels.name: sensor_temperature
channels.label: Outside temperature
channels.overview: The temperature outside, if reported by the boiler

channels.name: thermostat_mode
channels.label: Thermostat mode
channels.overview: Determines the mode of the thermostat, either ON ("Heat", 1), or OFF ("Off", 0). The heating setpoint will be applied if the mode Heat is applied and the Energy saving setpoint if the mode Off is applied

channels.name: thermostat_setpoint
channels.label: Heating setpoint
channels.overview: The setpoint used for the heating schedule

channels.name: thermostat_setpoint
channels.label: Energy save setpoint
channels.overview: The setpoint used for the energy save heating program
